page.title: 03HOUSES
page.content: The main style of architecture in this area is 17th/18th Century brick and flint, most of which has been well maintained and sympathetically restored.Several houses whose aspect has been lest changed are now included in the Dept of the Environments list of buildings of architectural or historical interest. There has been some development in this century, small groups of council houses ad some in-filling with small houses and bungalows. Being such a picturesque area within easy reach of the sea on the South coast. Stonehenge, Salisbury etc to the north, this is a popular area for tourists and there are several holiday cottages in the district, but surprisingly perhaps few establishments offering bed and breakfast facilites.
